content.description:
Crank patina edges past a finger pod, then make a reach to gain a jug at the start of the crack system. Once established in the crack rail out right to finish and descend the backside.

Fun moves on quality rock are found on this problem which is somewhat technical for the grade.
content.location: Located on the south face of the boulder and identified as thin face leading into a right-slanting crack system.

content.description:
Start around and right from

The Simpleton

from a low start and work up the slightly overhanging juggy arete to the crux just below the top as you transition around the arete and join the top of

The Simpleton

. Mostly positive holds the whole way but a good spot is necessary to keep you off the boulder at the base if you pitch. Descend the backside as per The Simpleton.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.protection: pads, spotter to keep you off a rock at the base
content.location:
Just right of

The Simpleton

on the juggy arete.

content.description: Climb the Simpleton, but instead of following juggy exit right, continue straight up and left a little bit to top out at the very rounded top of the boulder.
